reasons: DDoc doesn't support indented code blocks.
In DDoc, underscore characters [prevent identifier emphasis](https://dlang.org/spec/ddoc.html#emphasis) and are removed.
`---` [indicates a code block in DDoc](https://dlang.org/spec/ddoc.html#embedded_code), not a heading or thematic break.
The examples in this document are part of a single large DDoc block, so the fenced code blocks require a closing fence.

Unlike [HTML blocks in CommonMark](http://spec.commonmark.org/0.28/#html-block), the [embedded HTML in DDoc](https://dlang.org/spec/ddoc.html#embedded_html) only "passes through" content directly within HTML tags. The rest is subject to regular DDoc processing.
